Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: The final lecture will be on Monday, 15 July. (There is no lecture on Tuesday, 16 July.) I've just uploaded scanned lecture notes for §8.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: Oral exams for this course will be available on the following dates: Tue 23 July, Thu 25 July, Mon 29 July, Tue 30 July Tue 10 September Tue 1 October, Tue 8 October Both morning times (9:30-11:30) and afternoon times (13:00-15:00) will be available. More information about how to sign up for a particular time slot will be posted soon.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: The information about signing up for exams has now been posted on ISIS.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Teaching evaluation survey, handwritten lecture notes

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: Please fill out the evalution form for this course: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=X8L2Z Sorry I forgot to mention this in lecture this week. But please do complete the form. The deadline is this Saturday (29 June). In case it's useful, I've decided to upload my handwritten lecture notes. As before there is no guarantee that they are legible to anyone but me, but perhaps they're a good supplement to Reshetnyak's book.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: Unfortunately I'm sick with a fever, so there will be no in person lectures this week. I'll post some video lectures here on ISIS when I'm feeling a bit better, hopefully by Wednesday.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: The five videos are now available.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: No lecture tomorrow, conference on Discrete Differential Geometry

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: Today's lecture will be held as usual, but tomorrow's lecture is canceled, since this week there is a conference "Discrete Differential Geometry and Dimers" in Berlin MItte. Feel free to look at the schedule of talks and attend any that sound interesting: https://www.discretization.de/events/103/

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: I'm sorry, I have to cancel the lecture tomorrow morning (Tuesday, 7 May, 8-10h). Please help spread the word so nobody has to wake up early for nothing. I'll see you next week.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: I've decided to scan and upload my handwritten notes from the first few lectures. (No guarantee that they're legible or complete or correct!) Starting next week we will be following Reshetnyak's book, Chapter 3.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: We agreed today that the lectures on Tuesdays (in MA 549) will be 15 minutes later: from 8:30 to 10:00.
